objdescid.origination: Anonymous delineator. The inscriptions on the mount above and below the design, available under Related Works in the Archive, are not by Blake. They could not have been written before 1846, the earliest known date for the production of the paper on which the inscriptions are written. The identity of the calligrapher who wrote the inscriptions is not known.

objinfo.medium: pen and ink and water color

provenance.name: Rosenbach Museum and Library
provenance.note: Commissioned and acquired from Blake by Thomas Butts c. 1805; by inheritance in 1845 to Thomas Butts, Jr.; sold Sotheby's, 26 June 1852, lot 163 (£1.1s. to "Fuller," possibly a dealer, who still owned the work in 1863); Hugh Andrew Johnstone Munro; his estate or heirs by 1864; sold Christie's, 24 April 1868, lot 496 (£2.15s. to "Kibble," probably a dealer, possibly acting for Marsden J. Perry); sold by Perry in 1908 to William Augustus White; by inheritance to his son, Harold T. White, in 1927; sold to the dealer A. S. W. Rosenbach in 1950; bequeathed to the Rosenbach Museum and Library in 1952 and accessioned by the Museum in 1954.

desc.objtitle:
The Number of the Beast is 666,
Object 1 (Butlin 522)

objnote.p: Blake signed the work, lower right, with his monogram; see the textual transcription. The inscriptions above and below the design on the mount, available under Related Works in the Archive, are not by Blake. They could not have been written before 1846, the earliest known date for the production of the paper on which the inscriptions are written. The identity of the calligrapher who wrote the inscriptions is not known.

illustration.illusobjdesc: The design is based on Revelation 13:11-13, 18. The top half of the design is dominated by a dragon-like beast with the body of a man, a looping tail with two loops, outstretched bat-like wings, and seven heads. He is nude and his muscular body faces forward and right. His right leg is bent slightly, with his left leg drawn up. His right arm is at his side but bent upward, held against his chest. His left arm is raised horizontally but bent downward to brace himself on a rock, which his left hand holds. The figure sits on or perhaps is climbing a large rock or mountain. The figure's central head is that of a bald man with curling, bull-like horns, one loop in each horn. It also wears a spiky crown. This head is bent backward, facing up and right, mouth open. There are three heads to the left of the central head (see Revelation 13:13). The topmost head faces left and down; it has two curling horns with one loop in each. It may have curly hair as well. The middle head appears to be bald and faces left and down; it has one unicorn-like horn. The bottom head faces down and slightly left and is also bald. It wears a spiky crown and has one horn that curves downward over its forehead, ending in a loop. There are three heads to the right of the central head. The topmost head may have curly hair. It faces right and down and may wear a spiky crown. It has two horns that each end in a loop. The middle head may be bald and faces right. It may also wear a spiky crown and has one unicorn-like horn protruding from its head. The rightmost head is bald and faces right and down, mouth partly open. It wears a spiky crown and has one horn that grows downward over its forehead, ending in a single loop. Flames are visible above the central head. Seventeen stars appear on the wings of the creature in the top half of the design, eight on the left and nine on the right.. It casts a slight shadow to the right. At the base of the boulder or mountain is a sheep with human forearms and hands. The sheep may be hovering or lying down, facing left. It looks slightly up, with its eyes raised. It has short, curly fur covering its body with the exception of its face and human hands. Its arms are raised horizontally, palms held vertically. The scene takes place against the background of a dark night sky. At the bottom center of the design sits another hybrid man/beast figure, facing away. It appears to have the body of a nude, muscular man. Its left leg is visible, bent at the knee with the left foot on tiptoe. His spine is visible, as is a short, curly tail with one loop; it resembles a pig's tail. Fur is visible on its left thigh. Its left arm is raised at 135 degrees and fins are visible on the underside of the arm; the left hand points up and to the left. Its right arm is raised horizontally and bent upward. In its right hand it holds a scepter with a top that resembles a fleur-de-lis. This figure appears to have five bald heads, four facing away. The leftmost head has a single, unicorn-like horn protruding from the top of its head, with a small, spiky crown at the base of the horn. The middle head has a triangular bump at the top of its scalp, from which protrude two horns that curl downward, each ending in a single loop. The rightmost head looks to the right; it has a single, unicorn-like horn protruding from its scalp with a small, spiky crown at the base of the horn. The central figure at the bottom of the design casts a slight shadow beneath it. The central figure at the bottom of the design sits on a rock that may have moss or lichen at its base; the rock itself is colored to suggest flames. At the bottom right corner of the design, a mass of at least eleven figures kneels, facing left and down. The frontmost three figures appear to be gowned men with short hair; the figure in the front left has curly hair, a beard, and holds his arms horizontally, bent upward, with hands together in supplication or prayer. In the bottom left corner of the design kneels a group of at least fourteen people, facing to the right and down. In the frontmost row, two gowned men with short curly hair and a female(?) are visible. At least two figures have their arms bent upward with their hands together in a gesture of prayer or supplication.

component.illusobjdesc: The top half of the design is dominated by a dragon-like beast with the body of a man, a looping tail with two loops, outstretched bat-like wings, and seven heads. He is nude and his muscular body faces forward and right. His right leg is bent slightly, with his left leg drawn up. His right arm is at his side but bent upward, held against his chest. His left arm is raised horizontally but bent downward to brace himself on a rock, which his left hand holds. The figure sits on or perhaps is climbing a large rock or mountain. The figure's central head is that of a bald man with curling, bull-like horns, one loop in each horn. It also wears a spiky crown. This head is bent backward, facing up and right, mouth open. There are three heads to the left of the central head. The topmost head faces left and down; it has two curling horns with one loop in each. It may have curly hair as well. The middle head appears to be bald and faces left and down; it has one unicorn-like horn. The bottom head faces down and slightly left and is also bald. It wears a spiky crown and has one horn that curves downward over its forehead, ending in a loop. There are three heads to the right of the central head. The topmost head may have curly hair. It faces right and down and may wear a spiky crown. It has two horns that each end in a loop. The middle head may be bald and faces right. It may also wear a spiky crown and has one unicorn-like horn protruding from its head. The rightmost head is bald and faces right and down, mouth partly open. It wears a spiky crown and has one horn that grows downward over its forehead, ending in a single loop. Flames are visible above the central head (see Revelation 13:13). Nine stars appear on each of the creature's wings for a total of eighteen. It casts a slight shadow to the right.
Flames are visible above the central head of the figure dominating the top half of the design, which may suggest that it is breathing fire.
Seventeen stars appear on the wings of the creature in the top half of the design, eight on the left and nine on the right.
The creature dominating the top half of the design sits on a boulder or rocky mountaintop.

At the base of the boulder or mountain is a sheep with human forearms and hands. The sheep may be hovering or lying down, facing left. It looks slightly up, with its eyes raised. It has short, curly fur covering its body with the exception of its face and human hands. Its arms are raised horizontally, palms held vertically.
The scene takes place against the background of a dark night sky.

At the bottom center of the design sits another hybrid man/beast figure, facing away. It appears to have the body of a nude, muscular man. Its left leg is visible, bent at the knee with the left foot on tiptoe. His spine is visible, as is a short, curly tail with one loop; it resembles a pig's tail. Fur is visible on its left thigh. Its left arm is raised at 135 degrees and fins are visible on the underside of the arm; the left hand points up and to the left. Its right arm is raised horizontally and bent upward. In its right hand it holds a scepter with a top that resembles a fleur-de-lis. This figure appears to have five bald heads, four facing away. The leftmost head has a single, unicorn-like horn protruding from the top of its head, with a small, spiky crown at the base of the horn. The middle head has a triangular bump at the top of its scalp, from which protrude two horns that curl downward, each ending in a single loop. The rightmost head looks to the right; it has a single, unicorn-like horn protruding from its scalp with a small, spiky crown at the base of the horn. The central figure at the bottom of the painting casts a slight shadow beneath it.
The central figure at the bottom of the design sits on a rock that may have moss or lichen at its base; the rock itself is colored to suggest flames.
The figure at the bottom center of the design holds a scepter in its right hand that is topped with what may be a fleur-de-lis.

At the bottom right corner of the design, a mass of at least eleven figures kneels, facing left and down. The frontmost three figures appear to be gowned men with short hair; the figure in the front left has curly hair, a beard, and holds his arms horizontally, bent upward, with hands together in supplication or prayer.

In the bottom left corner of the design kneels a group of at least fourteen people, facing to the right and down. In the frontmost row, two gowned men with short curly hair and a female(?) are visible. At least two figures have their arms bent upward with their hands together in a gesture of prayer or supplication.

desc.objtitle:
The Number of the Beast is 666,
full view including mount inscriptions

objnote.p: The inscriptions on the mount above and below the design are not by Blake. They could not have been written before 1846, the earliest known date for the production of the paper on which the inscriptions are written. The identity of the calligrapher who wrote the inscriptions is not known.

desc.objtitle:
The Number of the Beast is 666,
top mount inscription

objnote.p: The inscription on the mount above the design is not by Blake. It could not have been written before 1846, the earliest known date for the production of the paper on which the inscription is written. The identity of the calligrapher who wrote the inscription is not known.

lg.l: The number of the Beast is 666.

desc.objtitle:
The Number of the Beast is 666,
bottom mount inscriptions

objnote.p: The inscriptions on the mount below the design are not by Blake. They could not have been written before 1846, the earliest known date for the production of the paper on which the inscriptions are written. The identity of the calligrapher who wrote the inscriptions is not known.

lg.l: Rev. ns ch: 13 th v. 11: th & 12: th
And I beheld another beast coming up out of the earth, and he had two
horns like a lamb, and he spake as a dragon. And he exerciseth all the powers
of the first beast before him, and causeth the earth & them which dwell therein to
worship the first beast, whose deadly wound was healed.
